alert.note: Alert for Bronx; Westchester (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 29 at 10:20PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast New York along the Bronx River, including the following counties, Bronx and Westchester. * WHEN...Until 545 AM EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1020 PM EDT, Flooding from earlier rainfall is expected to continue in the warned area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.50 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Yonkers, Mott Haven, East Tremont, Bronxville, Mount Vernon, Woodlawn, Tuckahoe and Fordham. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
